required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inferior Alveolar Nerve Lateralization With Simultaneous Implant Placement Versus the Use of Short Dental Implants
clinical_study.official_title: Inferior Alveolar Nerve Lateralization With Simultaneous Implant Placement Versus the Use of Short Dental Implants

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the long term stability of short dental implants in comparison to standard implants inserted simultaneously with inferior alveolar nerve lateralization.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: measuring the primary stability using the osstel

secondary_outcome.description: measuring the marginal bone loss by using CBCT

arm_group.arm_group_label: Inferior alveolar nerve lateralization with implant placement
Using short dental implant with atrophic mandible

intervention.description: Using short dental implant for patients with atrophic posterior mandible.
intervention.arm_group_label: Using short dental implant with atrophic mandible

intervention.intervention_name: Inferior alveolar nerve lateralization with simultaneous implant placement
intervention.description: Inferior alveolar nerve lateralization with simultaneous implant placement in atrophic posterior mandible.
intervention.arm_group_label: Inferior alveolar nerve lateralization with implant placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with edentulous posterior mandible.
- Both sexes.
- No intraoral soft and hard tissue pathology.
- No systemic condition that contraindicate implant placement.
- Residual alveolar bone width longer than 6 mm height (7-9 mm).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of fenestrations or dehiscence of the residual ridge.
- Heavy smokers more than 20 cigarettes per day .(24)
- Patients with systemic disease that may affect normal healing.
- Psychiatric problems
- Disorders to implant are related to history of radiation therapy to the head and neck neoplasia, or bone augmentation to implant site.
